article.aria-label: New Student Learning Packets Available April 15!

h3.a: New Student Learning Packets Available April 15!

div.div: Packets requested by parents will be available for pickup Wednesday, April 15 from 10-12 and 4-6 at each school. These packets will also be available online for students/parents to access. Governor Tate Reeves announced Tuesday that students will not be back in schools this semester. However, learning will continue and instruction will be offered to students through parent requested packets or online packets. Students need to continue their work at home during this time. Teachers will be available to help any student/parent that needs assistance. Stay safe!

article.aria-label: Change in Grab & Go Meal Program Beginning Monday, March 30

h3.a: Change in Grab & Go Meal Program Beginning Monday, March 30

div.div:
The Tishomingo County School District will change its “grab and go” breakfast/lunch pick up times to Monday and Wednesday ONLY beginning March 30th. These meals will contain breakfast and lunch meals for the week divided between the days. The district’s “grab and go” meal times are also changing. Times beginning Monday, March 30th, will be 10:00-12:00 noon. Pick up locations will remain the same and are as listed below:
• Belmont Elementary • Burnsville Elementary • Iuka Elementary • Tishomingo Middle.
Per federal regulations, all children 18 and younger are eligible for free meals, and children must be present in the vehicle to receive meals. If families have questions, they may contact the district office or school.
Click on the link for learn at home resources from the Mississippi Department of Education.
